Text:
Generate a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting readability level Upper Elementary. Limit the output to 150 words. Do not include the words 'food' and 'diets'. 

Proper nutrition is crucial for our bodies to function well. When we eat the right things, our bodies get the energy they need to run, grow, and repair themselves. Different parts of our bodies need different kinds of fuel. For example, our brains need a lot of energy to think and learn, so they need a lot of carbohydrates. Our muscles need protein to build and repair themselves, so they need a lot of protein. Our bodies also need healthy fats to help us absorb the good stuff from what we eat. By eating a balanced mix of different nutrients, we can stay healthy and strong. It's also important to drink plenty of water to keep our bodies hydrated. By taking care of our bodies with good nutrition, we can feel our best and be our best selves.

Minerals are important for keeping our bodies working right, like calcium to help build strong bones. Here is the text: Nutrition is the process of providing the body with the food it needs to function properly. This process involves eating a variety of foods that contain the right balance of nutrients. Nutrients are the building blocks of the body and are essential for growth, repair, and maintaining good health. There are six main categories of nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. Carbohydrates provide energy, proteins build and repair tissues, fats store energy, vitamins help the body function properly, minerals support the growth and development of the body, and water helps to regulate body temperature. A balanced diet that includes a variety of foods from all six categories is necessary to maintain good health. A diet that lacks one or more of these nutrients can lead to health problems. Therefore, it is essential to eat a well-balanced diet that includes foods from all six categories.

Finding the right balance is key to keeping our bodies strong and working properly. By making smart choices, we can give our bodies the nutrients they need to thrive.
